implicit_value: De term Pygmee heeft soms een negatieve bijklank. Waar mogelijk verdient het gebruik van de specifieke naam van een subgroep de voorkeur.

implicit_value: Whenever possible, use the specific tribal name; many groups now prefer [alternative]; use [alternative]
notes: alternatives are given: "American Indian" or "Indigenous American."; For the indigenous peoples of Canada use the term "First Nations."; the scopeNote has changed: the explanations of ehy the term was senitive and suggestions are changed; on 11.08.2023:  Whenever possible, use the specific tribal name. The collective term "Native American" is currently widely used in the United States for indigenous peoples. However, many groups increasingly prefer "American Indian" or "Indigenous American." For the indigenous peoples of Canada use the term "Indigenous peoples." which refers to the First Nations, Inuit and Métis. For the broader concept of the cultures of any native peoples of Central America, South America, North America, or the West Indies, use "Indigenous people (culture)."@en ; explicit markers: http://vocab.getty.edu/term/kind/AvoidUse is not defined; only one label is flagged, but there are other labels with the term "Indian"; for example http://vocab.getty.edu/aat/term/1000267642-en "Indian, American" is not flagged;
